item.title: तारों के लिए 1,000 किमी केबल - स्काईहूक ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: वीडियो ट्रांसक्रिप्ट ﻿अंतरिक्ष में जाना कठिन है। अभी, यह विस्फोटकों से भरे बैकपैक के साथ साइकिल से पर्वत पर चढ़ने जैसा है। अभी, यह विस्फोटकों से भरे बैकपैक के साथ साइकिल से पर्वत पर चढ़ने जैसा है। अविश्वसनीय रूप से धीमी गति से, आप बहुत सारे सामान का परिवहन नहीं कर सकते, और आप मर भी सकते हैं। एक रॉकेट को पृथ्वी से भागने के लिए लगभग 40,000 किमी प्रति घंटे के वेग तक पहुंचने की आवश्यकता है।

item.title: Evaluatie Van Drie Redenen Waarom Cannabis Illegaal Moet Blijven ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcriptie ﻿Op de hele wereld wordt cannabis gedecriminaliseerd of zelfs gelegaliseerd. Maar is dat wel een goed idee? Op het internet worden de schadelijke kanten vaak geminimaliseerd. Laten we dus de drie beste argumenten bekijken om cannabis niet te legaliseren. Argument 1: cannabis in een harddrug. In de jongste decennia is cannabis zo gekweekt om veel sterker te worden. Cannabis is vandaag zo sterk dat het een harddrug is die tot psychose kan leiden.

item.title: 3个理由为什么大麻应该继续非法化审查 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: 视频 文字稿 ﻿在全世界中 大麻正在被除罪化甚至合法化。 但是这真的是一个好主意吗？ 在网络上的争论中， （大麻合法化）有害的一面常常不被重视。 所以让我

item.title: 3 Alasan Mengapa Energi Nuklir Sangat Buruk! ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripsi ﻿3 Alasan Kenapa kita harus berhenti menggunakan energi nuklir pertama Senjata nuklir berkembang pesat teknologi nuklir membuat pintu masuk kekerasan kedalam dunia Hanya dalam 1 tahun setelah test nuklir pertama di dunia pada tahun 1944 2 kota besar telah dihancurkan oleh 2 bom tunggal setelah itu , teknologi reaktor perlahan berkembang yang berfungsi untuk menghasilkan tenaga listrik tapi itu selalu dihubungkan dengan teknologi senjata nuklir Hal ini hampir mustahil untuk mengembangkan senjata nuklir

item.title: 3 Dôvody, prečo je jadrová energia hrozná! ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Prepis ﻿Tri dôvody, prečo by sme mali prestať používať jadrovú energiu. Šírenie jadrových zbraní Jadrová technológia spôsobila násilný vstup na svetovej scéne. Len rok po prvom výbuchu jadrového testu na svete v 1944 boli zničené dve veľké mestá dvoma samostatnými bombami. Na to sa technológia reaktorov pomaly vyvinula ako prostriedok generovania elektriny, ale vždy bola úzko spojená s technológiou jadrových zbraní. Je takmer nemožné rozvíjať jadrové zbrane bez prístupu k technológii reaktorov.

item.title: Un Cable de 1,000 km a las Estrellas - El Gancho Aéreo ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcripción ﻿Ir al espacio es difícil. En este momento es como escalar una montaña en un monociclo con una mochila llena de explosivos. Increíblemente lento, no puedes llevar muchas cosas, y quizás mueras. Un cohete tiene que alcanzar una velocidad de alrededor 40,000 Kilómetros por hora para escapar de la Tierra. Para alcanzar esa velocidad, los cohetes son principalmente contenedores de combustible con una pequeña parte de carga en la punta.

item.title: 1000 км кабел до звездите - небесното куче ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Видео Транскрипция ﻿Стигането до космоса е трудно. В сегашния момент е все едно да се качвате на планина с колело с една гума … с раница, пълна с експлозиви. Невероятно бавно, не можете да транспортирате много неща, а може и да умрете. На една ракета и е нужна скорост около 40 000 км в час, за да избяга от Земята. За да стигнат до тази скорост, ракетите са основно контейнери с гориво с мъничък товар

item.title: Sejarah Baru untuk Kemanusiaan - Era Manusia ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripsi ﻿Manusia telah wujud sejak berjuta-juta tahun, sebagai sebahagian daripada alam . Kemudian, sesuatu berubah. Dalam masa yang amat singkat kita mengubah planet ini dan merekanya untuk memenuhi keperluan kita. Setakat yang kita tahu, kita makhluk pertama yang bangunkan dan mengambil alih sebuah planet. Peralihan dari memburu dan mengumpul, ke pertanian dan bangunan, begitu cepat hingga kebanyakan cara kita berfikir tentang dunia tiada guna lagi. Salah satu idea kita yang paling kolot ialah kalendar yang paling biasa digunakan di dunia menegaskan bahawa kita hidup pada tahun 2016.

item.title: Nova zgodovina za človeštvo - Človeška doba ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Prepis ﻿Ljudje so obstajali na milijone let, kot del narave. Ampak potem se je nekaj spremenilo. In v neverjetno kratkem času smo spremenili planet, da ustreza našim potrebam. Kolikor vemo, smo prva bitja, ki so se prebudila in popolnoma prevzela planet. Prehod od lova in nabiranja do kmetovanja in gradnje, je bil tako osupljivo hiter, da veliko naših načinov razmišljanja o svetu ni več uporabnih. Ena od naših najbolj zastarelih idej je,

item.title: Az emberi történelem új korszaka - Az Emberi Korszak ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Videó Tranzkript ﻿Az emberek több millió évig a természet részeként éltek. De aztán valami megváltozott és hihetetlenül rövid idő alatt a szükségleteink szerint alakítottuk át a bolygót. Jelenlegi tudásunk szerint mi vagyunk az első élőlények, amik teljesen irányításuk alá vettek egy bolygót. A vadászatról és gyűjtögetésről a termelésre és építkezésre való átállás olyan hihetetlen gyors volt, hogy a világgal kapcsolatos számos felfogásunk mára teljesen idejétmúlttá vált. Az egyik legelavultabb ezek közül az, hogy a legelterjedtebb naptár alapján

item.title: Una Nueva Historia para la Humanidad - La Era Humana ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcripción ﻿Los humanos hemos existido en la naturaleza durante millones de años. Pero un día algo cambió y en un periodo de tiempo increíblemente corto terraformamos este planeta y lo diseñamos para adaptarlo a nuestras necesidades. Que sepamos, somos la primera especie en despertar y controlar por completo un planeta. Pasamos tan rápidamente de cazar y recolectar a sembrar y construir que muchas de nuestras formas de ver el mundo ya no son útiles.

item.title: O nouă istorie pentru umanitate - Era umană. ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcriere ﻿Oamenii au existat timp de milioane de ani ca parte din natură. Dar apoi, ceva s-a schimbat. într-un timp incredibil de scurt am tansformat aceasta planetă și am modificat-o după nevoile noastre. Din câte știm, suntem primele ființe care au preluat complet controlul asupra unei planete. Tranziția de la vânat și cules, la agricultură și construcții, a fost atât de rapidă încât multe din modurile noastre de gândire asupra lumii nu mai sunt folositoare.

item.title: 人類の新しい歴史 - 人類時代 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: ビデオ 転写 ﻿人は数百万年間 自然の中にいた しかしある時変化が起き 驚くべき早さで 人は地球を便利に改造していった 目覚めた最初の存在は 瞬く間に惑星を

item.title: Nauja žmonijos istorija - Žmogaus era ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripcija ﻿Žmonės, kaip gamtos dalis, egzistavo milijonus metų. Bet tada kai kas pasikeitė. Ir per neįtikėtinai trumpą laiko tarpą. Mes pakeitėme šią planetą ir pritaikėme ją savo reikmėms. Kiek žinome, mes esame pirmosios būtybės įgavusios sąmonę ir visiškai perėmusios planetą į savo rankas. Perėjimas nuo medžioklės ir maisto rinkimo iki ūkininkystės bei statybos buvo toks beprotiškai greitas, jog didelė dalis to, kaip mes suvokėme pasaulį, neteko prasmės. Tai, jog dauguma plačiausiai naudojamų kalendorių teigia, jog mes gyvename 2016-taisiais metais, yra viena iš labiausiai atgyvenusių mūsų idėjų.

item.title: Nova povijest za čovječanstvo - Era čovjeka ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripcija ﻿Ljudi su postojali milijunima godina, kao dio prirode. Ali onda, nešto se promijenilo. I u nevjerojatno kratkom vremenu oblikovali smo ovaj planet i dizajnirali ga kako bi odgovarao našim potrebama. Koliko nam je poznato, mi smo prva bića koja su se probudila i i potpuno preuzeli planet. Prijelaz iz lova i sakupljanja, na uzgoj i građenje, bio je tako zapanjujuće brz da mnogi od naših načina razmišljanja o svijetu više nisu korisni.

item.title: Uma Nova História para a Humanidade - A Era Humana ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Vídeo Transcrição ﻿Os humanos existem há milhões de anos como parte da natureza, mas então, algo mudou, e em uma quantidade incrivelmente pequena de tempo nós terraformamos este planeta e fizemos com que atendesse às nossas necessidades. Até onde sabemos, somos os primeiros seres a acordar e tomar completamente um planeta. A transição de caçar e coletar para plantar e construir foi tão impressionantemente rápida… …que muitas de nossas maneiras de pensar no mundo não são mais úteis.

item.title: मानवता के लिए एक नया इतिहास - मानव युग ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: वीडियो ट्रांसक्रिप्ट ﻿कड़ोरों वर्षों से मानवजाती प्रकॄति का अंश रहा है। मगर तब, अचानक, बहुत कम समय में, कुछ बदलने लगा। हमने अपने ज़रूतों को पूरा करने के लिए इस ग्रह को भूपरिवर्तित कर लिया। हमारे ज्ञान के सीमा में हम वह पहले प्राणी हैं जिनहोंने जागरुकता से संपूर्ण ग्रह पर काबू कर लिया। शिकार और फल इकट्ठा करने से लेकर कॄषी और निर्माण तक का परिवर्तन इतना जलदी हुआ कि हमारे सोचने के कई भाव-तरीके आज के युग मैं अर्थहीन बन गए हैं।

item.title: Uma Nova História para a Humanidade - A Era Humana ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Vídeo Transcrição ﻿Os humanos existem por milhões de anos como parte da natureza, mas então, algo mudou, e em uma quantidade incrivelmente pequena de tempo nós terraformamos este planeta e o desenhamos para que atendesse às nossas necessidades. Até onde sabemos, somos os primeiros seres a acordar e tomar completamente um planeta. A transição de caçar e coletar para plantar e construir foi tão impressionantemente rápida… …que muitas de nossas maneiras de pensar no mundo não são mais úteis.

item.title: Una Nueva Historia para la Humanidad - La Era Humana ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcripción ﻿Los humanos han existido por millones de años como parte de la naturaleza Pero luego algo cambió Y en muy poco tiempo nosotros terraformamos este planeta y lo diseñamos para satisfacer nuestras necesidades hasta donde sabemos, somos los primeros seres en despertarnos y tomar el control del planeta. La transición de cazar y recolectar a cultivar y construir, fue tan increíblemente rápida que muchas de las maneras de pensar sobre el mundo ya no son útiles.

item.title: Ihmiskunnan uusi historia - Ihmisen aikakausi ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkriptio ﻿Ihmiset ovat olleet olemassa osana luontoa miljoonien vuosien ajan. Mutta sitten jokin muuttui ja hämmästyttävän lyhyessä ajassa me muokkasimme tämän planeetan ja suunnittelimme sen vastamaan tarpeitamme. Omien tietojemme mukaan olemme ensimmäisen laji koskaan, joka on kyennyt ottamaan koko planeetan haltuunsa. Muutos metsästäjä-keräilijäkulttuurista maanviljelyyn ja rakentamiseen oli niin nopea, että monet ajattelutapamme maailmasta eivät ole enään käyttökelpoisia. Yksi jälkeenjääneimmistä ideoistamme on se, että käytetyin kalenteri maailmassa väittää, että elämme vuotta 2016.

item.title: 人类的新历史——人类时代 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: 视频 文字稿 ﻿人类作为大自然的一部分已经存在了数百万年。 然而，在很短暂的一段时间内，一些东西改变了 我们改变了这个星球， 并根据我们的需要来设计。

item.title: En Ny Historie for Menneskeheten - Den Menneskelige Æra ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripsjon ﻿Mennesket har eksistert i millioner av år som en del av naturen. Men så skjedde det noe. I løpet av utrolig kort tid terraformet vi planeten, og tilpasset den etter våte egne behov. Så vidt vi vet, er vi den første arten som noen gang har fullstendig tatt over en planet. Overgangen fra å være jegere og samlere, til å være bønder og byggmestere, skjedde så utrolig fort at mange av måtene vi fortsatt tenker på, ikke lenger er nyttige.

item.title: Новая история человечества - Эра Человека ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Видео Транскрипт ﻿Люди миллионы лет существовали, как часть природы Но затем кое-что изменилось И за невероятно короткий промежуток времени мы изменили эту планету, для удовлетворения наших потребностей Насколько мы знаем, мы – первые существа, которые пробудились и полностью взяли контроль над планетой. Переход от охоты и собирательства к земледелию и строительству был столь молниеносным, что многие наши способы мышления о мире, более неприменимы. Одна из наших наиболее устаревших идей –

item.title: 人類的新歷史 - 人類時代 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: 影片 文字稿 ﻿人類與大自然已經共處了數百萬年之久 但在極短的時間內，某些事發生了 人類改變了這顆星球，以符合我們的需求 就我們所知，人類是第一個覺醒

item.title: היסטוריה חדשה עבור האנושות - עידן האדם ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: וידאו טְק֡ס֙ט ﻿בני אדם היו קיימים במשך מיליוני שנים, כחלק מהטבע. אבל אז, משהו השתנה, ובפרק זמן קצר ביותר שינינו את העולם הזה והתאמנו אותו לצרכינו. ככל שאנחנו יודעים, אנחנו היצורים הראשונים שקמו ולגמרי השתלטו על כוכב לכת. המעבר מציד ואיסוף לחקלאות ובנייה, היה מהיר כל כך באופן עוצר נשימה שרוב הדרכים בהן חשבנו על העולם הן כבר לא מועילות. אחד הרעיונות הכי מיושנים שלנו הוא שלוח השנה עם השימוש הכי נפוץ בעולם מתעקש שאנחנו חיים בשנת 2016.

item.title: Una nova història per a la humanitat - L'era humana ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcripció ﻿Els humans hem existit a la natura durant milions d’anys. Però un dia alguna cosa va canviar i en un període de temps increïblement curt vam transformar el planeta i el vam dissenyar per adaptar-lo a les nostres necessitats. Que sapiguem, som la primera espècie a despertar i controlar per complet un planeta. Vam passar tan ràpidament de caçar i recol·lectar a sembrar i construir que moltes de les nostres formes de veure el món ja no són útils.

item.title: تاريخ جديد للبشرية - العصر البشرى ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: فيديو نص ﻿تواجد البشر كجزء من الطبيعة لملايين من السنين. ولكن , حدث تغيير في وقت قصير بشكل مذهل. لقد اخضعنا الكوكب وصممناه ليكون مناسبًا لاحتياجاتنا. وبقدر ما نعرف , نحن اول كائنات تستعمر وتسود كوكبًا. وكان الانتقال من الصيد والحصاد الى البناء والزراعه سريعًا جدًا مما جعل بعض افكارنا عن العالم لا قيمه لها. واحدة من اكثر الافكار التى عفا عليها الزمن أن التقويم الاكثر استخدامًا يُصر أننا نعيش في العام 2016.

item.title: İnsanlık İçin Yeni Bir Tarih - İnsanlık Çağı ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkript ﻿İnsanlar doğanın bir parçası olarak, milyonlarca yıldır var olmuştur. Ama sonra bir şeyler değişti ve inanılmaz derecede kısa bir sürede bu gezegeni şekillendirip ihtiyaçlarımıza uyacak şekilde tasarladık. bildiğimiz kadarıyla gözü açılıp bir gezegeni fetheden ilk varlıklarız avlanma ve toplamadan tarıma ve inşaya geçiş o kadar nefes kesici bir hızdaydı ki Dünya hakkında düşündüğümüz bir çok yol artık kullanılabilir değil hükmü kalmamış fikirlerimizden biri çoğunlukla kullanılan takvim 2016’da yaşadığımıza ayak direr

item.title: Yeni bir insanlık tarihi - İnsan Çağı ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Myndband Handrit ﻿Menn hafa fyrirfunndist í milljónir ára sem hluti náttúrunnar. En síðan breytist eitthvað, og á ótrúlega stuttum tíma mótuðum við þessa plánetu og hönnuðum hana til þess að hæfa þörfum okkar. Að því er við vitum best, erum við fyrstu verunar til að vakna og algjörlega taka yfir plánetu. Umbreytingin frá að veiða og safna í að rækta og byggja var svo undralega hröð, að margir hugsunarháttar okkar um heimin eru ekki lengur gagnlegir.

item.title: Nova Historio por la Homaĵo - La Homa Epoko ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transskribo ﻿Homo ekzistas dum milionoj da jaroj, kiel parto de naturo. Sed tiam, io ŝanĝiĝis. Kaj dum ege mallonga kvanto de tempo, ni teroformigis ĉi tiun planedon kaj desegnis ĝin por taŭgi niajn bezonojn. Laŭ nia scio, ni estas la unuaj estaĵoj vekiĝi kaj tute transpreni planedon. La transiĝo de ĉasado kaj kolektado, al farmado kaj konstruado, estis tiom senspirige rapida, ke multe da niaj manieroj de pensi pri la mondo ne plu estas utilaj.

item.title: Inimajandus uus ajalugu - Inimajastu ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkriptsioon ﻿Inimesed on olnud looduse osa miljoneid aastaid. Aga siis muutus midagi ja uskumatult lühikese ajaga kujundasime selle planeedi ümber ja kohandasime selle oma vajadustega. Meile teadaolevalt oleme esimesed ärganud ja planeedi täielikult üle võtnud olendid. Üleminek küttimiselt ja koriluselt põllundusele ja ehitamisele oli nii hingematvalt kiire, et paljude meie arusaamadega maailma asjadest ei ole enam midagi peale hakata. Üks meie kõige aegunumatest ideedest seisneb selles, et meie kõige enamkasutatavam kalender

item.title: Нова історія для людства - Ера людини ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Відео Транскрипція ﻿Мільйони років люди існували як частина природи. Але потім щось змінилося. І за неймовірно короткий проміжок часу Ми змінили лице цієї планети та пристосували її до наших потреб. Наскільки нам відомо, ми є першими створіннями, які пробудилися та повністю заволоділи планетою. Перехід від мисливства й збирання до землеробства та будівництва був настільки вражаюче швидким, що ми більше не можемо покладатись на наші уявлення про світ. Одне з найбільш застарілих уявлень у тому, що за найрозповсюдженішим календарем світу ми нібито живемо у 2016 році.

item.title: En ny historie for menneskeheden - Menneskeæraen ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transskription ﻿Mennesker har eksisteret i millioner af år som en del af naturen. Men så ændrede noget sig. Og i et utroligt kort tidsrum, terraformerede vi denne planet, og designede den til at passe til vores behov. Så vidt vi ved, er vi de første skabninger til at vågne og helt overtage en planet. Overgangen fra jagt og samling til landbrug og byggeri var så ubeskrivelig hurtig, at mange af de måder, vi ser verden på, ikke længere er nyttige.

item.title: Nowa Historia Dla Ludzkości - Era Człowieka ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkrypcja ﻿Ludzie istnieli przez miliony lat jako część przyrody lecz wtedy coś się zmieniło i w niezwykle krótkim okresie czasu zmieniliśmy tę planetę i dostosowaliśmy ją do naszych potrzeb. Z tego co nam wiadomo, jesteśmy jedynymi istotami, które “przebudziły się” i całkowicie zdominowały swoją planetę. Przejście z łowiectwa i zbieractwa do rolnictwa i budownictwa nadeszło tak szybko, że wiele sposobów myślenia o tym świecie okazuje się nieprzydatne Jednym z naszych najmniej aktualnych pomysłów jest fakt, że według najczęściej używanego kalendarza żyjemy w roku 2016.

item.title: En ny historia för mänskligheten - Människans era ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkription ﻿Människor har funnits i miljontals år som en del av naturen. Men plötsligt ändrades något och på väldigt kort tid terraformade vi planeten och utformade den för att passa våra behov. Så vitt vi vet är vi de första varelserna som totalt har tagit över en planet. Övergången från jägare-samlare till jordbruk och byggande var så otroligt snabb att många av våra tankesätt inte längre är användbara. En av våra mest utdaterade idéer är att den mest använda kalendern idag insisterar att vi lever i år 2016.

item.title: Een nieuwe geschiedenis voor de mensheid - Het tijdperk van de Mens ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcriptie ﻿De mensheid bestaat al voor miljoenen jaren als een onderdeel van de natuur. Maar toen veranderde iets. En in een heel erg korte tijd, hebben we deze planeet geterraformeerd en ontworpen om onze benodigdheden te voldoen. Voor hoever wij weten zijn wij het eerste ras die compleet zijn eigen planeet heeft overgenomen. De verandering van jagen en bijeenkomen naar landbouw en bouwen, was zo adembenemend snel dat veel van onze manieren om over de wereld te denken niet langer van toepassing waren.

item.title: ประวัติศาสตร์ใหม่สำหรับมนุษย์ชาติ - ศักราชมนุษย์ ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: วิดีโอ สรุป ﻿มนุษย์มีชีวิตอยู่มานานนับล้านปี เป็นส่วนหนึ่งของธรรมชาติ แต่แล้วเกิดการเปลี่ยนแปลง และในเวลาที่สั้นอย่างไม่น่าเชื่อ เราปรับโลกใบนี้และออกแบบ เพื่อให้พอดีกับความต้องการของเรา เท่าที่เรารู้ เรากำลังเป็นพวกแรกที่ตื่นรู้ และครองโลกอย่างสมบูรณ์ การเปลี่ยนแปลงจากการล่าสัตว์ และเกิดชุมชนเพื่อการเกษตรและสร้างบ้าน ก็เป็นไปอย่างรวดเร็ว จนหลายอย่างที่เคยคิดเอาไว้เกี่ยวกับโลกนี้ ใช้ไม่ได้แล้ว หนึ่งในความคิดที่ล้าสมัยที่สุดของเราคือ ปฏิทินที่ใช้มากที่สุดในโลกยืนยันว่าเรามีชีวิตอยู่ในปี 2016 มุมมองนี้บิดเบือนประวัติศาสตร์ของเราเอง และทำให้มันยากที่จะเข้าใจว่าเราเป็นใคร และที่เรามาได้ไกลแค่ไหน ในเวลาที่สั้นอย่างไม่น่าเชื่อ บางทีมันอาจจะถึงเวลาที่จะเลือกปีที่ 0 สำหรับมนุษยชาติ ปี 0 ที่แท้จริงหมายถึงเราเป็นสายพันธุ์และรวมถึงทุกวัฒนธรรม ปี 0 คือจุดที่เราเริ่มสร้างโลกใหม่ของเราทับโลกใบเก่า 12,000 ปีที่ผ่านมา มนุษย์หลายร้อยมารวมกัน อยู่ในภูเขาทางตอนใต้ของอนาโตเลีย พวกเขาล่าสัตว์และเก็บของป่า ไม่มีความรู้ การเกษตรหรือการใช้โลหะ ทั้งหมดที่พวกเขามีอยู่ คือ เครื่องมือที่ทำจากหินและไม้ แต่พวกเขาสร้างความเป็นมนุษย์อย่างแรก โครงการก่อสร้างขนาดใหญ่ 7,000 ปีก่อนที่ปิรามิดที่ถูกสร้างขึ้นในอียิปต์ วงของเสาหินขนาดใหญ่ที่บรรพบุรุษของเราสร้างขึ้น กินเนื้อที่กว่า 300 เมตร แต่ละอัน สูงถึง 6 เมตร และน้ำหนัก 40 ตัน การตกแต่งด้วยศิลปะรูปสัญลักษณ์ และแกะสลักหินรูปสัตว์และสัตว์ในตำนาน เราคิดไม่ออกว่า พวกเขาสามารถที่จะทำเช่นนี้ มันอาจจะเป็นโครงการขนาดใหญ่สำหรับยุคหิน ซึ่งต้องใช้ระดับงานแบบองค์กร เราไม่อาจรู้ได้ ว่ามนุษย์เริ่มแรกมีความสามารถนี้ จนเรามาพบสถานที่นี้ ดังนั้น ทำไมพวกเขาสร้างมัน? ทฤษฎีที่นิยมมากที่สุด คือ นี้เป็นวัดแรกของมนุษยชาติที่อุทิศแด่พระเจ้าที่ถูกลืมมานาน

item.title: Нова историја за човечанство - Ера човека ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Видео Транскрипт ﻿Људи постоје, као део природе, милионима година. Али се онда нешто променило. И за невероватно кратко време смо тераформитрали планету и дизајнирали је да одговара нашим потребама. Колико знамо, ми смо прва бића која су пробудила и комплетно освојила планету. Транзиција од лова и сакупљања до земљорадње и изградње је била толико брза, да многи од наших погледа на свет више нам нису корисни Једна од наших најзастарелијих идеја је та да, најчешће коришћени календар на планети

item.title: İnsanlıq Üçün Yeni Tarix - İnsanlıq Erası ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkriptlər ﻿İnsanlar təbiətin bir hissəsi olaraq milyonlarla ildir yaşayırlar. Amma bəzi şeylər dəyişib. və inanılmaz dərəcədə qısa bir müddətdə planeti dəyişib, ehtiyaclarımızı ödəməsi üçün dizayn etmişik. Bildiyimiz kimi, oyanaraq planeti ələ keçirən ilk canlılarıq. Ovçuluq və yığıçılıqdan əkinçilik və quruculuğa keçid o qədər tez oldu ki, bir çoxumuzun dünya haqda düşüncələri artıq yararlı deyil. Ən köhnəlmiş fikirlərimizdən biri ən çox istifadə olunan təqvimə görə 2016-cı ildə yaşamağımızdır. Bu tariximiz haqda olan düşüncələrimizi təhrif edib, bizim irq olaraq kim olduğumuzu və

item.title: Нова история за човечеството - Ерата на Човека ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Видео Транскрипция ﻿Хората са съществували милиони години като част от природата. Но нещо се е променило. И за невероятно кратък период сме изменили планетата, така че да подхожда на нуждите ни. Доколкото знаем, сме първите същества, завладели напълно цяла планета. Преминали сме от лов и събирачество към земеделие и строителство толкова бързо, че много от идеите ни за света вече не са полезни. Една от най-остарелите ни идеи, е че най-широко разпространения календар в света гласи, че живеем в 2016-та година.

item.title: 인류를 위한 새 역사 - 인류대 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: 비디오 대본 ﻿인류는 수 백만년 동안 자연의 일부로서 존재해 왔습니다. 하지만 그 이후, 무언가가 변했습니다. 믿기지 않을 만큼 짧은 시간동안 우리는 이 행성을 변화시

item.title: Une Nouvelle Histoire pour l'Humanité – L'Ère Humaine ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Vidéo Transcription ﻿Les humains ont existé dans la nature durant des millions d’années. Mais ensuite, quelque chose a changé. Et dans un laps de temps incroyablement court, nous avons terraformé cette planète et l’avons modifiée pour répondre à nos besoins. Pour autant que nous sachions, nous sommes les seuls êtres à nous réveiller et prendre le contrôle d’une planète entière. La transition de chasse et cueillette à agriculture et construction fut si incroyablement rapide

item.title: Sejarah Baru untuk Kemanusiaan - Era Manusia ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripsi ﻿Manusia telah ada selama jutaan tahun, sebagai bagian dari alam. Tapi kemudian, sesuatu berubah. Dan dalam jumlah yang sangat singkat, …kita mengubah planet ini dan dirancang agar sesuai dengan kebutuhan kita. Sejauh yang kita tahu, kita adalah makhluk pertama untuk membangkitkan dan benar-benar mengambil alih planet. Peralihan dari berburu dan mengumpulkan, menuju pertanian dan membangun, begitu cepat, sehingga banyak dari cara kita berpikir tentang dunia yang tidak lagi berguna.

item.title: Một Lịch sử Mới cho Nhân Loại - Thời đại Nhân Loại ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Bản trích ﻿Loài người đã tồn tại hàng triệu năm như là một phần của tự nhiên. Nhưng bỗng dưng có thứ gì đó đã thay đổi, và nó chỉ xảy ra trong chớp nhoáng. Chúng ta đã khai phá hành tinh này và thiết kế lại nó để đáp ứng những nhu cầu của chúng ta. Cho tới hiện tại, chúng ta là sinh vật duy nhất thức tỉnh và chiếm lấy hoàn toàn hành tinh này.

item.title: A New History for Humanity – The Human Era ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transcript ﻿Humans have existed for millions of years, as part of nature. But then, something changed. And in an incredibly short amount of time.. ..We terraformed this planet and designed it to fit our needs. As far as we know, we’re the first beings to awaken and completely take over a planet. The transition from hunting and gathering to farming and building, was so breathtakingly fast, that many of our ways of thinking about the world are no longer useful.

item.title: Ein neues Zeitalter der Menschheit – Die menschliche Ära ｜ Kurzgesagt
Isang Bagong Kasaysayan para sa Sangkatauhan - Ang Panahon ng Tao ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripsyong ﻿Ang mga tao ay nagsimula noong milyong taong nagdaraan, bilang parte ng kapaligiran. Pero noong panahon na iyon, may nag-iba. At sa isang sobrang madaling panahon… ..binago natin ang mundong ito at dinisenyo ito upang magkasya ang aming mga pangangailangan. Bilang malayo bilang alam namin, tayo ay ang unang nilalang na at ganap na kumuha ng higit sa isang planeta. Ang paglipat mula sa pangangaso at pagtitipon sa pagsasaka at gusali, ay saksakan ng bilis,

item.title: Nová historie pro lidstvo - Éra lidstva ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Transkripce ﻿Lidé existovali miliony let jako část přírody. Ale pak se něco změnilo. A ve velmi krátkém čase jsme planetu přeměnili tak, aby vyhovovala našim potřebám. Pokud víme, jsme první bytosti, které probudily a úplně ovládly planetu. Přechod od lovu a sběru k zemědělství a stavebnictví byl tak dechberoucí a rychlý, že mnohé způsoby, kterými přemýšlíme o světě, už dnes nejsou užitečné. Jedním z našich nejvíce zastaralých nápadů je, že nejpoužívanější kalendář světa tvrdí, že žijeme v roce…

item.title: Una Nuova Storia per l'Umanità – L'Era Umana – Il Primo Calendario 12.017 ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Trascrizione ﻿L’uomo è esistito per milioni di anni, come parte della natura, ma poi, qualcosa è cambiato e in un tempo incredibilmente breve, abbiamo terraformato questo pianeta e l’abbiamo progettato per soddisfare le nostre esigenze. Per quanto ne sappiamo, siamo i primi esseri ad esserci risvegliati e ad aver preso il controllo completo di un pianeta. Il passaggio da caccia e raccolta ad agricoltura e costruzioni, è stato così sorprendentemente veloce

item.title: মানবতার জন্য একটি নতুন ইতিহাস - মানব যুগ। ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: ভিডিও ট্রান্সক্রিপ্ট ﻿মানুষ প্রকৃতির অংশ হিসাবে, কোটি কোটি বছর ধরে টিকে আছে. কিন্তু তারপর, কিছু পরিবর্তন. এবং সময় একটি অবিশ্বাস্যভাবে স্বল্প পরিমাণ আমরা এই গ্রহের terraformed এবং আমাদের চাহিদা মাপসই এটা পরিকল্পিত. যতদুর আমরা জানি, আমরা প্রথম মানুষ জাগ্রত এবং সম্পূর্ণরূপে একটি গ্রহের উপর নিতে যাচ্ছেন ট্রানজিশন শিকার ও জমায়েত থেকে, চাষাবাদ এবং ভবন, তাই breathtakingly দ্রুত যে বিশ্বের সম্পরকে আমাদের উপায়ে অনেক লোক আর দরকারী ছিল. আমাদের সবচেয়ে সেকেলে ধারণা এক বিশ্বের মধ্যে সবচেয়ে বেশি ব্যবহৃত ক্যালেন্ডারের যে জোরাজুরি যে আমরা 2016 বছরের মধ্যে বাস

item.title: Nová história pre ľudstvo - Ľudská éra. ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Video Prepis ﻿Ľudia existujú už milióny rokov ako súčasť prírody. Ale potom sa niečo zmenilo a v neuveriteľne krátkom čase sme premenili túto planétu a nadizajnovali ju aby odpovedala našim potrebám. Zatiaľ podľa toho čo vieme sme prvé bytosti ktoré sa prebudili a úplne osídlili planétu Zmena od lovu a zberu k farmárčeniu a stavaniu bola tak neuveriteľne rýchla, že veľa našich myšlienok o svete sú už nepoužiteľné Jedna z našich najzastaralejších myšlienok

item.title: Μία Καινούρια Ιστορία για την Ανθρωπότητα - Η Εποχή των Ανθρώπων ｜ Kurzgesagt
item.description: Βίντεο Αποσπάσματα ﻿Οἱ ἄνθρωποι ὑπάρχουν ἐδῶ καὶ ἐκατομμύρια ἔτη, ὡς μέρος τῆς φύσεως. Ἀλλὰ μετά, κάτι ἄλλαξε. Καὶ σὲ ἕνα πολὺ μικρὸ χρονικὸ διάστημα, γαιοποιήσαμε αὐτὸν τὸν πλανήτη καὶ τὸν σχεδιάσαμε σύμφωνα μὲ τὶς ἀνάγκες μὰς. Ἀπὸ ὅσο γνωρίζουμε, εἴμαστε τὸ πρῶτο εἴδος ποὺ ἀφυπνίστηκε καὶ κατέλαβε ἐντελῶς ἕναν πλανήτη. Ἡ μετάβαση ἀπὸ τὸ κυνῆγι καὶ τὴν συλλογὴ τροφῆς, στὴν γεωργία καὶ τὴν δόμηση, ἦταν τόσο τρομακτικὰ γρήγορη, ὥστε ὁ τρόπος ποὺ σκεπτόμαστε γιὰ κάποια πράγματα δὲν εἶναι πλέον χρήσιμος.

item.title: Apple - Évènement Apple - 18 octobre
item.description: Vidéo Transcription ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ Bonjour ! Bon retour à Apple Park, pour notre deuxième évènement en un peu plus d’un mois. Chez Apple, nous sommes focalisés sur la création de produits et d’expériences innovantes. Des produits qui permettent à nos utilisateurs d’exprimer leur créativité, et de profiter de celle des autres. Aujourd’hui, nous nous concentrons sur deux aspects importants : la musique et le Mac. Commençons avec la musique.

item.title: Apple - Evento de Apple — 18 de octubre
item.description: Vídeo Transcripción [♪♪] [♪♪] Buenos días. Bienvenidos de nuevo a Apple Park para nuestro segundo evento en poco más de un mes. En Apple, nos enfocamos en crear productos y experiencias innovadoras, productos que le ofrecen a nuestros usuarios nuevas maneras de expresar su creatividad y disfrutar de la creatividad de otros. Hoy nos enfocaremos en dos áreas importantes: la música y la Mac. Empecemos con la música. La música juega un papel tan importante en nuestras vidas.

item.title: Apple - Презентация Apple, 18 октября
item.description: видео Транскрипт ♪ ♪ ♪ ♪ Доброе утро и добро пожаловать в Apple Park! Чуть больше месяца прошло с нашей прошлой встречи. Наша главная задача в Apple – создавать инновационные продукты и уникальные возможности, новые способы творческого самовыражения и восприятия того, что создают другие. Поэтому сегодня наши главные темы – музыка и Mac. Начнём с музыки. Музыка играет такую важную роль в нашей жизни. Она нас вдохновляет, пробуждает к жизни и объединяет.

Das ist ein wichtiger Teil unserer Arbeit bei Apple und inspiriert alles, was wir tun.

item.title: Apple - Évènement Apple - 14 septembre
item.description: Vidéo Transcription ♪ ♪ Bonjour ! Et merci de nous avoir rejoint. J’adore l’énergie de cette ouverture. Cela représente ce qu’est la Californie pour nous. La Californie, ça a toujours été l’endroit des ambitieux et des rêveurs. Un endroit où les gens ont l’envie de rendre les choses meilleures De faire des choses qui peuvent changer le monde. C’est une grosse partie de qui nous sommes à Apple, et c’est ce qui nous inspire dans tout ce que nous créons et faisons.

item.title: Apple - Evento de Apple - 14 de septiembre
item.description: Vídeo Transcripción [♪♪] [♪♪] Buenos días. Gracias por acompañarnos. Me encanta la increíble energía de esa apertura. Representa qué sentimos de California. California siempre ha sido un lugar para gente con grandes ambiciones y sueños, un lugar donde la gente es impulsada con optimismo para mejorar las cosas, para hacer cosas que pueden cambiar el mundo. Es una parte muy importante de quiénes somos aquí en Apple y nos inspira en cada cosa que creamos y hacemos.

item.title: Apple - Презентация Apple, 14 сентября
item.description: видео Транскрипт [♪ ♪] [♪ ♪] Доброе утро! Спасибо, что вы с нами. Мне нравится невероятная энергетика, с которой мы начинаем сегодня. Именно так мы ощущаем Калифорнию. Она притягивает к себе смелых деятелей и больших мечтателей. Здесь люди заряжены на созидание, на изменение мира к лучшему. Это место живёт в каждом, кто работает в Apple. Оно вдохновляет нас на всё, что мы делаем и создаём. Мы гордимся тем, что Калифорния – наш дом.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2021 — June 7
item.description: Video Transcript [person] For me, WW is the Super Bowl. [person] You can feel the energy. [person] It’s like really deep insights of what it feels like being a developer. [person] Really? [person] Wow. [laughs] [person] Okay, we open on black. The curtain slowly opens. Have a DeLorean on the stage. Tim Cook gets out of that DeLorean, showing the phone’s flux capacitor. [person] I would probably not start there.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2021 — June 7 - Deutsch
item.description: Video Transkript Für mich ist die WW der Super Bowl. Man spürt die Energie. Man bekommt einen detaillierten Eindruck davon, wie es ist, Entwickler zu sein. WIR HABEN ENTWICKLER GEBETEN, SICH EINE ERÖFFNUNGSSEQUENZ FÜR DIE WWDC21 AUSZUDENKEN. Echt? Wow. DIES SIND IHRE IDEEN OK, wir starten mit Schwarz. Der Vorhang geht langsam auf. Auf der Bühne steht ein DeLorean. Tim Cook steigt aus und zeigt ein Telefon mit Fluxkompensator. Da würde ich nicht anfangen.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2021 — June 7 - Español
item.description: Vídeo Transcripción Para mí, WW es como el Super Bowl. Puedes sentir la energía. Es como una profunda perspectiva de lo que se siente al ser programador. LE PEDIMOS A LOS PROGRAMADORES QUE PENSARAN EN UNA INTRODUCCIÓN PARA WWDC21 ¿En serio? Vaya. ESTAS SON SUS IDEAS Bueno, empezamos con un fondo negro. La cortina se abre lentamente. Hay un DeLorean en el escenario. Tim Cook sale de ese DeLorean, mostrando el capacitador de flujo del teléfono.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2021 — June 7 - Français
item.description: Vidéo Transcription La WWDC pour moi, c’est le Super Bowl. On sent l’énergie. C’est un aperçu en détail de ce que c’est qu’être un dévoloppeur. Vraiment ? Waouh. On ouvre sur le noir. Les rideaux s’ouvrent lentement. On a une DeLorean sur la scène. Tim Cook descend de la DeLorean, en montrant le convecteur temporel du téléphone. Je ne commencerais probablement pas par là. Je pense que c’est un peu geek.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2021 — June 7 - русский
item.description: видео Транскрипт Для меня WW - это Суперкубок. Он полон энергии. Начинаешь по-настоящему понимать что значит быть разработчиком. Мы попросили разработчиков придумать пролог к фильму WWDC21 Правда? Ого! Они предложили свои идеи. Ладно, вначале - чёрный экран. Занавес медленно раздвигается. На сцене стоит ДеЛориан. Тим Кук выходит из него, показывая конденсатор потока в своём телефоне. Я бы не стал так начинать. Мне кажется, это чуть-чуть заумно. Снято! Будем переснимать? Итак, вначале - чёрный экран.

item.title: Apple - Презентация Apple — 20 апреля
item.description: видео Транскрипт [♪ ♪] [♪ ♪] Привет Я рад вас снова приветствовать в Apple Park на нашем первом событии в 2021 году. Прошлый год был непростым, но мы уверены, что вот-вот наступят яркие и радостные дни. Мы двигаемся дальше и ещё больше осознаем, как важно, чтобы компания Apple продолжала приносить пользу людям, донося до них наши продукты и ценности. Мы рады, что вы с нами сегодня. Вас ждут впечатляющие новинки и анонсы.

item.title: Apple - Evento de Apple — 10 de noviembre
item.description: Vídeo Transcripción Hola y bienvenidos. Qué gusto que nos acompañen. Estoy emocionado por este día y por las noticias que les daremos. Me parece asombroso que este sea nuestro tercer gran evento en estos últimos dos meses. En medio de los desafíos enormes de este año nuestra gente se mantuvo concentrada y no ha parado de innovar. Nuestro ritmo de lanzamiento de productos es increíble. Este otoño presentamos más productos nuevos que nunca.

item.title: Apple - Презентация Apple – 10 ноября
item.description: видео Транскрипт Здравствуйте, рад снова вас видеть. Здорово, что вы к нам присоединились. Сегодня замечательный день, и нам есть чем с вами поделиться. Потрясающе, что это наша третья крупная презентация за последние два месяца. Несмотря на огромные трудности этого года, наши команды целенаправленно внедряли инновации. Мы выпускаем новую продукцию невероятными темпами и этой осенью представили больше продуктов, чем когда-либо прежде, начиная с обновления наших мощных операционных систем и заканчивая замечательной продукцией.

item.title: Apple - Apple Event — September 15
item.description: Video Transcript Good morning and welcome. We are so pleased that you could join us today. We’ve got some really exciting product announcements to share with you. As we all continue to make our way through these difficult times and face the challenges that COVID-19 is causing in our communities around the world, it’s so inspiring how people everywhere have adapted: working remotely, learning from home and gathering virtually to stay close to family and friends.

item.title: Apple - Apple Event — September 15 - Español
item.description: Vídeo Transcripción Buenos días y bienvenidos. Nos da mucho gusto que hoy nos acompañen. Queremos compartirles anuncios emocionantes de productos. Conforme avanzamos en estos tiempos difíciles y enfrentamos los retos que provoca la COVID-19 en comunidades de todo el mundo, nos parece muy inspirador ver cómo se ha adaptado la gente: por medio del teletrabajo, el aprendizaje en el hogar y las reuniones virtuales para estar cerca de familiares y amigos.

item.title: Apple - Apple Event — September 15 - русский

Мы все сейчас переживаем трудности, связанные с распространением COVID-19 по всему миру, и очень вдохновляет то, как люди смогли адаптироваться: удаленно работать, дистанционно обучаться и виртуально общаться с родными и друзьями. И приятно видеть, какую важную роль играют наши продукты, помогая людям оставаться на связи в это непростое время.

item.title: Apple - WWDC 2020 Special Event Keynote
item.description: Video Transcript [“Daydreamer” by Aurora playing] Good morning. And welcome to WWDC. WWDC is an incredibly important event to Apple, our developers and our users. It’s here that we bring some of our biggest innovations to life. And we have not stopped innovating, doing the work that will enrich people’s lives for years to come. Because we’re all looking forward to a more hopeful tomorrow. That’s why we believe it’s so important to have WWDC this year.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 30 The Celtic Legacy
item.description: Podcast Transcript Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 30, The Celtic Legacy. In this episode, we’re going to explore the impact of the Celtic languages on modern English, and we’re going to look at the ultimate fate of the native Britons when they encountered the Anglo-Saxons. Now this may seem like a straightforward topic, but actually it’s a topic that’s perplexed

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 29 The Anglo-Saxon Invasion
item.description: Podcast Transcript Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 29, the Anglo-Saxon invasion. In this episode, we’re going to explore the invasion of Britain by the Anglo-Saxons. And specifically, we’re going to look at the period from around the year 410, when the Roman Empire abandoned Britain, until around the year 600. These two centuries are sometimes called the lost centuries of British history because

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 28 Angles, Saxons, Jutes and Frisians
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 28, Angles, Saxons, Jutes, and Frisians. This time, we’re going to turn our attention northward, to the peoples of Northern Europe who spoke the Germanic dialects which became Old English. These were the Angles, Saxons, and Jutes, and we can probably add in the Frisians, as well as some Franks. All of these people spoke closely related West Germanic languages, and they all lived

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 27 Broken Empire and Fractured Languages
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 27, Broken Empire and Fractured Languages. This time, we’re going to look at the final years of the Western Roman Empire and the rise of new Germanic kingdoms in its place. And these political events coincided with the division of Latin and the Germanic languages into new dialects and languages. And these newly emerging languages evolved into many of the languages of modern Western

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 26 Imperial Crisis and the Goths
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 26, Imperial Crisis and the Goths. This time, we’re going to explore a period of Roman history which is sometimes called the Imperial Crisis, and this period coincides with the rise of a group of Germanic tribes who invaded Rome during the same time frame. These tribes included the ancient Goths, and the Goths are particularly important to us

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 25 Germanic Markings and the Runes
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 25, Germanic Markings and the Runes. In this episode, we’re going to continue to look at the early Germanic tribes, but this time around we’re going to focus on events in southern Germania. We’re going to look at the southward migration of Germanic tribes to the Danube region, where they met the Romans and eventually met the alphabet.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 24 Germanic Mythology
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 24, Germanic Mythology. The last time I looked at the writings of the Roman historian Tacitus, and I used his book Germania to explore early Germanic society. In this episode, I’m going to continue exploring Germanic culture, but this time I want to focus on Germanic mythology and religion, and the impact that Germanic mythology has

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 23 Tacitus and Germanic Society
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 23, Tacitus and Germanic Society. In this episode, we’re going to explore the social, legal, and political culture of the early Germanic tribes, and I’m going to do that by using the writings of the Roman historian Tacitus, who provided us with the first detailed look at the early Germanic tribes.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 22 Early Germanic Grammar
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 22, Early Germanic Grammar. In this episode, we’re going to continue our look at the earliest Germanic language. Specifically, we’re going to focus on the grammar of the early Germanic tribes. But before I begin, let me thank all of you who’ve purchased the History of the Alphabet series. That series is still available through iTunes and Amazon.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 21 Early Germanic Words
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 21, Early Germanic Words. In this episode, we’re going to look at the first evidence of Germanic writing, and we’re going to begin looking at the original Germanic language by focusing on the vocabulary which they used. But before I begin, let me remind you that the History of the Alphabet series or audiobook

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Bonus Episode 2 History of the Alphabet
item.description: Hi, everyone. Welcome to this bonus episode of the History of English podcast. Unfortunately, I don’t have a new episode of the podcast ready this week. I hope to have one ready next week. But the reason I don’t have a new episode ready is because I finally committed myself to finishing that alphabet series, which I’ve been mentioning from time to time. And I’m happy to report that that series is finally ready.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 20: The Early Germanic Tribes
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 20, The Early Germanic Tribes. In this episode, I’m going to look at the emergence of the first Germanic tribes in Northern Europe. So, we’ll be looking at the peoples and the languages which gave birth to English. That means that from this point forward in the podcast, we’ll be establishing a continuum

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 19: The Romanization of Britain
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 19, The Romanization of Britain. In this episode, I’m going to look at the emergence of the Roman Empire following the death of Julius Caesar. And then I’m going to look at what happened when the Romans decided to make another attempt to conquer Britain. As you probably already know, the Romans had more luck this second time around.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 18: Keeping Time With The Romans
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 18, Keeping Time with the Romans. The last time we looked at the emergence of the ancient Celts who once dominated much of Central and Western Europe, and we looked at the defeat of those same Celts by the Romans in the region known as Gaul, which is basically modern day France.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 17: Ancient Celts and the Latin Invasion of Gaul
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 17, Ancient Celts and the Latin Invasion of Gaul. In this episode, we’re going to look at the ancient Celts, the people who once dominated much of Europe. And we’ll look at the spread of Rome and Latin into many of the territories where the Romance languages are being spoken today.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 16 The Rise of Rome – and Latin
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 16, The Rise of Rome and Latin. In this episode, we’re going to look at the emergence of Rome from a small city near the western coast of Italy to the dominant political and military power of the Mediterranean. And this will set the stage for the expansion of Latin throughout the western world.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 15: Etruscans, Romans and a Modified Alphabet
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. This is episode 15, Etruscans, Romans, and a Modified Alphabet. In this episode, we’re going to turn our attention from the Eastern Mediterranean to the West, specifically to Italy. In the past few episodes, I’ve discussed the significant influence of Greek on English. Now we start to look at the tremendous influence of Latin.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 11: Germanic Ancestors
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. In this episode, we’re going to look at the emergence of the Germanic tribes, the early Greek speakers, the first Latin-speaking tribes in Italy, and the Celtic tribes in Central and Western Europe. So we’re going to begin a shift from the original Indo-Europeans to the various daughter languages, which directly influenced the development of English.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 4: A Grimm Brother Resurrects the Dead (…language)
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language. In this episode, we’re going to look at how a fairy tale collector helped to resurrect a dead language, specifically the Indo-European language. In the last couple of episodes, we’ve looked at William Jones’ discovery that almost all the languages of Europe, as well as several languages of Central Asia, were all descended from an ancient common ancestor.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 3 The Indo-European Family Tree
item.description: Welcome to the History of English podcast, a podcast about the history of the English language and the people who contributed to that history. In the last episode, we looked at how a British judge in India helped to discover the oldest known ancestor of English, the ancient Indo-European language. In this episode, we’ll look more closely at the Indo-European family of languages and how English fits into that family.

item.title: The History of English Podcast - Episode 2: The Indo-European Discovery
item.description: Welcome to Episode 2 of the History of English podcast. In this episode, we’re going to look at the oldest known ancestor of English, the ancient language known as Indo-European, or technically speaking, the Proto-Indo-European language. This is the story of the discovery of that language, and the man who is credited for that discovery, Sir William Jones. In presenting a history of English, I believe that it’s important to begin at this point.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 15 of 15: Next in the Investigation
item.description: As of last summer, authorities have Ron Hulse’s DNA swab. They agreed to do a direct comparison test against the partial male profile found on Darlene’s blouse. Not because Ron is a suspect, but because he’s her husband. If that DNA belongs to Ron, then it actually means the profile is kind of useless. Maybe it was from their hug goodbye that morning when he went to work, in which case it means that we need to start testing other items while we still can to get a suspect sample.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 14 of 15: A Massive Revelation
item.description: For almost four decades, no one questioned Darlene’s cause of death. And honestly, at first, neither did we. We didn’t set out to debunk the cause of death in Darlene’s case, but when we went through the pathologist’s 1984 findings, a few things just didn’t make sense. It wasn’t that we thought the report was wrong or that we knew more than a trained pathologist. In fact, it was the opposite.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 13 of 15: Untangling Misinformation
item.description: When we made the discovery about the Parson family, it made us question everything Nelson had told us so far. And again, Lemon and Parson are pseudonyms because these guys have never publicly been named suspects by law enforcement. So to see if this was just some kind of huge mix-up, we first reached out to a former employee of Nelson’s who Emily had interviewed prior. She’s actually the one who was assigned to be the liaison

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 12 of 15: P.I.'s Best Lead
item.description: About a year before we got involved with Darlene’s case, her family worked with a private investigator, Patrick Zirpoli, who goes by Zip to those who know him. Zip spent his career with the Pennsylvania State Police. He retired in 2015 as a corporal and the unit supervisor of the Criminal Investigation Assessment Unit. One of his specialties is cold case homicide investigations, and after retirement, he’s gone on to consult in cold cases.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 11 of 15: Bad Seed
item.description: In any good investigation, you’re running down multiple leads at once. It’s not just a time efficiency thing, it’s what helps you avoid getting tunnel vision. So one of the times we met with Nelson, it wasn’t just Kenneth McCune Jr.’s name that we brought up. We also asked him about another name. We said, hey, what do you know about John Paul Clark? Did your office ever seriously look at him?

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 10 of 15: Look at the Deeds
item.description: Everyone from the current prosecutor to the FBI back in 87 say the same thing. Look at where her body was found. Her killer knew the area, knew where he was going to take her. If that’s true, we decided to see what the land would tell us. So we pulled the deed records for the lot where Darlene was found, and we looked at parcels around it. And sure enough, right up the road is McCune Farms, LLC.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 9 of 15: Let's Go for a Ride
item.description: We’re just a mile south of Plymouth on Old 31 headed south to Argus. Argus is about 15 minutes south of Plymouth, and it’s mostly just cornfields and backroads between the two towns. Once you turn off of New US 31 onto Old Highway 31, you cross some railroad tracks, and a few miles south of there, you pass right by Brandi Peltz’s old house, where she was murdered in 1986.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 8 of 15: It All Goes Through One Guy
item.description: In 2016, Kristen was all grown up and a mom of her own when she decided to take her mom’s cold case into her own hands. It got to a point about seven years ago where I was like, okay, I want to do this. I was sitting at home with little kids and I just started reaching out like, hey, is there anything new, anything going on? Who can I talk to?

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 7 of 15: Bring in the FBI
item.description: By January 1987, Marshall County authorities were noticing a pattern emerging. Here’s an excerpt read from Sergeant Dave Yokelet’s case summary. In the past several years, since 1982, this officer has been involved in the investigating of several violent crimes that have occurred in the extreme southern portion of Marshall County, Indiana. Two of those crimes involved homicides, one of which was in 1984, the Hulse Homicide, the other in 1986, the Peltz Homicide.

item.title: Behind The Tech with Kevin Scott - Year in Review 2022
item.description: KEVIN SCOTT: Hi, everyone. Welcome to Behind the Tech. I’m your host, Kevin Scott, Chief Technology Officer for Microsoft. In this podcast, we’re going to get behind the tech. We’ll talk with some of the people who have made our modern tech world possible and understand what motivated them to create what they did. So, join me to maybe learn a little bit about the history of computing and get a few behind-the-scenes insights into what’s happening today.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 6 of 15: Evil All Around
item.description: Before moving on to other suspects, whose names were coming in via phone calls and letters from the public, investigators knew what they had to do next—give Ron Hulse another polygraph test. I say another because they actually gave him one just three days after Darlene’s abduction, which he passed. And listen, Ron was never a suspect. But back then, officers knew that they had to play offense and defense.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 5 of 15: He's Gunned Down
item.description: On October 25th, 1984, all the way out in Amarillo, Texas, a 29-year-old man named Ricky Mock went into a convenience store and held the cashiers and guests at gunpoint, demanding money. When he got what he was looking for, he took off, only to be pulled over a few hours later by an Amarillo officer who noticed his Indiana plates. Ricky assumed that they knew it was him who robbed the place,

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 4 of 15: They Left Town
item.description: Before Darlene’s body had even been found, a tip had come in to police. A man named Jim Garman suggested they check out the home of a woman named Thelma Burns. He said there were a lot of quote-unquote druggies and creeps who stayed there. When police went by to talk to him the next evening, this now being after Darlene’s body had been found, Jim Garman’s tip had gotten even more specific, and it pointed the finger

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 3 of 15: The Wooded Path
item.description: Walter Grosnickle finally had some free time on Saturday, August 18th, 1984 to make the hour-long drive from his house in North Manchester, Indiana, to Argus to check out some land that he’d been interested in buying for his timber operations. This was actually the second time he had driven there to have a look, but he wanted to double check the trees on the plot before he moved forward with actually buying it.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 2 of 15: A Stranger's Wrath
item.description: Everett Fish was the reserve officer who passed 20B Road. The dirt roads off the highway aren’t well marked, and it’s easy to do. I even missed it my first time up there. It took about .2 seconds for him to realize what he’d done and make a U-turn back toward the Hulse House, which was just a stone’s throw away from the highway with a cornfield and a barn between.

item.title: The Deck Investigates - 1 of 15: Take a Bath

item.title: The Deck Investigates - Darlene Hulse (4 of Hearts, Indiana)
item.description: Argus, Indiana is small, more corn stalks than people in 1984. It’s one of those places where neighbor means something different. Everyone’s your neighbor, but each house is a corn or soybean field away. The home of the Hulse family was just like that, tucked away off a major road through town with fields to the front and back. Ron Hulse built the home himself for his wife Darlene and their three daughters.

Irving tried to fight off his attacker in an intense struggle, leaving behind a horrific crime scene and a mystery that has endured for nearly 15 years.

Massachusetts, one of those damp New England days when all you want to do, is slide out of your wet coat, warm your hands and order a drink at a cozy bar. This particular bar has a speakeasy Vibe, heavy velvet curtains and dark wood accents, but that’s not the first thing you notice. 0:25 When you walk in we sent reporter Amory sivertson to go check it out.

In 1992, Dale was a 23-year-old woman enjoying a night out with friends when suddenly she vanished from a crowded club, never to be seen again. Maybe the right person listening to this episode will change that. I’m Ashley Flowers, and this is The Deck. On September 24th, 1992, at 6.15 in the morning, Dan Dinwiddie was just getting out of bed.

It is, however, part of my desire and effort to bring zero cost to consumer information about science and science-related tools to the general public. In keeping with that theme,

item.title: Hora de andar - Hora de andar con Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas: Cuando era niño amaba caminar con mi padre. Vivíamos en una casita de ladrillo en Wyckoff, Nueva Jersey, a dos puertas de la iglesia donde mi padre era cura. Y había un camino de vuelta por el bosque cerca de un cementerio. El cementerio me daba un poco de miedo, pero el tiempo que pasé con mi padre caminando por ese camino, hablando de la vida, la música y la creatividad fue un recuerdo favorito mientras crecía.

item.title: Hora de caminhar - Hora de caminhar com Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas: Quando eu era criança, adorava andar com meu pai. Morávamos em uma casinha de tijolos em Wyckoff, Nova Jersey, duas portas abaixo da igreja onde meu pai era pastor. E havia um caminho de volta pela floresta que continha um cemitério. O cemitério era meio assustador para mim, mas o tempo que passei com meu pai caminhando por esse caminho de volta, falando sobre a vida, música e criatividade foram algumas das minhas memórias favoritas enquanto crescia.

item.title: Marcher - Marcher avec Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas : Quand j’étais petit, j’adorais marcher avec mon père. On habitait une petite maison en briques à Wyckoff dans le New Jersey, à deux maisons de l’église où mon père officiait en tant que pasteur. Il y avait un chemin à travers la forêt qui longeait un cimetière. Le cimetière me faisait un peu peur, mais les marches avec mon père sur ce petit chemin où l’on parlait de la vie, de la musique et de la créativité sont parmi les meilleurs souvenirs de mon enfance.

item.title: Passeggiamo - Passeggiamo con Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas: Quando ero piccolo, adoravo andare a camminare con mio padre. Abitavamo in questa casetta di mattoni a Wyckoff, in New Jersey, a due edifici dalla chiesa dove mio padre faceva il pastore. C’era questo sentiero sul retro che attraversava il bosco affiancando un cimitero. Il cimitero mi faceva abbastanza paura, ma il tempo trascorso con mio padre a passeggiare lungo questo sentiero, a parlare della vita, di musica e creatività, è uno dei più bei ricordi d’infanzia che ho.

item.title: Time to Walk - Time to Walk with Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas: When I was a kid I used to love walking with my dad. We lived at this little brick house in Wyckoff, New Jersey, two doors down from the church that my dad was the pastor at. And there was this back pathway through the woods that neighbored a cemetery. The cemetery was kind of frightening to me, but the time spent with my father walking down this back path, talking about life and music and creativity were some of my favorite memories growing up.

item.title: Zeit fürs gehen - Zeit fürs gehen mit Nick Jonas
item.description: Nick Jonas: Als ich ein Kind war, ging ich gerne mit meinem Vater spazieren. Wir wohnten in einem kleinen Backsteinhaus in Wyckoff, New Jersey, zwei Türen weiter von der Kirche entfernt, in der mein Vater Pastor war. Es gab einen Weg durch den Wald, der direkt an einen Friedhof grenzte. Der Friedhof machte mir irgendwie Angst, aber die Zeit, die ich mit meinem Vater auf diesem Pfad verbrachte und in der wir über das Leben, die Musik und die Kreativität sprachen, gehörte zu meinen schönsten Erinnerungen an meine Kindheit.

item.title: Время ходить - Время ходить с Ником Джонасом
item.description: Ник Джонас: Когда я был ребенком, я любил гулять с отцом. Мы жили в маленьком кирпичном доме в Уайкоффе, Нью-Джерси, в двух шагах от церкви, в которой мой отец был пастором. С нашего заднего двора шла тропинка через лес, неподалеку от кладбища. Кладбище меня немного пугало, но время, проведенное с моим отцом, гуляя по этой тропинке, разговаривая о жизни, музыке и творчестве, было одним из моих любимых воспоминаний в детстве.

item.description: I mean, I’ve definitely experienced moments where I didn’t want to do anything but chess. I’d also say that’s pretty universal. I think if you want to be the best at anything you do or any sport, you have to be that level of obsessed. The following is a conversation with Alexandra and Andrea Botez. They’re sisters, professional chess players, commentators, educators, entertainers, and streamers. Their channel is called Botez Live on Twitch and YouTube.

item.title: Hora de andar - Hora de andar con Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda: Siempre he amado caminar porque siempre he amado explorar. Siempre he amado la naturaleza. Mi lugar favorito para caminar es en la profundidad de un bosque oscuro porque me hace ser consciente de las capas del tiempo y de la vida. ​ [MÚSICA INTRODUCTORIA] ​ Sam Sanchez: Es Time to Walk, donde algunas de las personas más interesantes e inspiradoras del mundo comparten historias, fotos, y canciones que han influenciado sus vidas.

item.title: Hora de caminhar - Hora de caminhar com Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda: Eu sempre gostei de andar porque sempre gostei de explorar. Sempre gostei da natureza. O meu lugar favorito para caminhadas é no interior de uma floresta escura porque me torno consciente do tempo e da vida. ​ [MÚSICA DE INTRODUÇÃO] ​ Sam Sanchez: É hora do Walk, onde as pessoas mais interessantes e inspiradoras do mundo compartilham as suas histórias, fotos e músicas que influenciaram suas vidas. Vencedora do Oscar por duas vezes, Jane Fonda é uma atriz lendária, produtora, escritora e ativista.

item.title: Marcher - Marcher avec Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda : J’ai toujours aimé marcher parce que j’ai toujours aimé explorer. J’ai toujours aimé la nature. Mon endroit favori pour une randonnée est dans les profondeurs d’une forêt sombre et dense parce que ça me rend très consciente du passage du temps et de la vie. ​ [MUSIQUE D’INTRO] ​ Sam Sanchez : C’est Place à la marche, où certaines des personnes les plus intéressantes et inspirantes au monde partagent des histoires, des photos et des chansons qui ont influencé leur vie.

item.title: Passeggiamo - Passeggiamo con Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda: Ho sempre amato passeggiare, principalmente perché ho sempre amato esplorare. Ho sempre amato la natura. Il mio posto preferito per passeggiare sono le profondità di una foresta oscura, perché divento molto consapevole degli strati del tempo e della vita. ​ [MUSICA INTRODUTTIVA] ​ Sam Sanchez: Questo è Passeggiamo, in cui alcune delle persone più interessanti e ispiratrici del mondo condividono storie, foto e canzoni che hanno influenzato le loro vite.

item.title: Time to Walk - Time to Walk with Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda: I’ve always loved walking mostly because I’ve always loved exploring. I’ve always loved nature. My favorite place to walk is in the depths of a deep, dark forest because I become very conscious of layers of time and of life. ​ [INTRO MUSIC] ​ Sam Sanchez: It’s Time To Walk, where some of the world’s most interesting and inspiring people share stories, photos, and songs that have influenced their lives.

item.title: Zeit fürs gehen - Zeit fürs gehen mit Jane Fonda
item.description: Jane Fonda: Ich habe das Wandern schon immer geliebt, vor allem, weil ich schon immer gerne auf Entdeckungstour gegangen bin. Ich habe die Natur schon immer geliebt. Am liebsten gehe ich in den Tiefen eines tiefen, dunklen Waldes spazieren, weil mir dann die Schichten der Zeit und des Lebens sehr bewusst werden. ​ [INTRO-MUSIK] ​ Sam Sanchez: It’s Time To Walk, wo einige der interessantesten und inspirierendsten Menschen der Welt Geschichten, Fotos und Lieder teilen, die ihr Leben beeinflusst haben.

item.title: Время ходить - Время ходить с Джейн Фондой
item.description: Джейн Фонда: Я всегда любила ходить пешком, в основном потому, что всегда любил исследовать. Я всегда любила природу. Больше всего мне нравится гулять в гуще темного леса, потому что я очень хорошо чувствую пласты времени и жизни. ​ [ВСТУПИТЕЛЬНАЯ МУЗЫКА] ​ Сэм Санчес: Time To Walk – это проект, в котором самые интересные и вдохновляющие люди в мире делятся историями, фотографиями и песнями, которые повлияли на их жизнь. Двукратный лауреат премии «Оскар» Джейн Фонда - легендарная актриса, продюсер, писательница и активистка.

item.title: The Deck - Leah Ulbrich (3 of Clubs, Connecticut)
item.description: Our card this week is Leah Ulbrich, the Three of Clubs from Connecticut. For months now, I’ve anticipated the release of this episode for a few reasons. One is because the investigation is still very active and new discoveries were made while our team was reporting on Leah’s case. Actual breakthroughs that could lead to her murder getting solved. And the second reason is because Leah’s family, who’s been waiting nearly 30 years for answers, talked to us for this episode.

item.title: Huberman Lab - How to Optimize Testosterone & Estrogen
item.description: Welcome to the Huberman Lab Podcast, where we discuss science and science-based tools for everyday life. I’m Andrew Huberman, and I’m a professor of neurobiology and ophthalmology at Stanford School of Medicine. This podcast is separate from my teaching and research roles at Stanford. It is, however, part of my desire and effort to bring zero cost to consumer information about science and science-related tools to the general public. Our first sponsor is Athletic Greens.

item.title: Hora de andar - Hora de andar con Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu: Caminar me hace sentir bien. El sonido de la grava, la hierba, del soplar de las hojas y del susurro de los árboles, y se pueden oír a los pájaros dispersarse en los arbustos o a las lagartijas correr. A mí eso me recuerda que no estamos solos, que hay un planeta y vidas a nuestro alrededor, que somos una parte de esto. ​ Caminar reestablece la conexión con la realidad, con el planeta Tierra.

item.title: Hora de caminhar - Hora de caminhar com Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu: Andar sempre me motiva. Há um certo som do cascalho, da grama, das folhas soprando e do barulho das árvores, e você pode ouvir pássaros nos arbustos ou lagartos correndo através deles. E para mim, esses são os lembretes de que você não está sozinho, que existe um planeta e vidas ao seu redor e que você é uma parte disso. ​ Caminhar meio que restabelece uma conexão com a realidade, com o planeta Terra.

item.title: Marcher - Marcher avec Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu : La marche me permet de trouver un certain équilibre. Le bruit des graviers, de l’herbe, des feuilles qui tombent et des arbres, on entend les oiseaux s’envoler ou les lézards courir. Pour moi, tout cela nous rappelle que nous ne sommes pas seuls, que l’on est sur une planète entourés de vie, et que l’on en fait partie. ​ La marche permet de se reconnecter avec la réalité et avec la planète Terre.

item.title: Passeggiamo - Passeggiamo con Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu: Camminare mi insegna sempre qualcosa. Il rumore della ghiaia, dell’erba, delle foglie che volteggiano, il fruscio degli alberi e gli uccellini che saltellano sui cespugli o le lucertole che vi guizzano in mezzo. Tutti questi suoni mi ricordano che non siamo soli, che c’è un pianeta che vive intorno a noi e che noi siamo un tassello di tutto questo. ​ Camminare, in un certo senso, ristabilisce un contatto con la realtà, con il pianeta Terra.

item.title: Time to Walk - Time to Walk with Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu: Walking always grounds me. There’s a certain sound of the gravel, of the grass, of the leaves blowing and the rustling of the trees, and you can hear birds scatter in the bushes or lizards run across. And to me, those are the, the reminders that you’re not alone, that there is a planet and lives all around you and that you are one piece of this.

item.title: Zeit fürs gehen - Zeit fürs gehen mit Jon M. Chu
item.description: Jon M. Chu: Wandern erdet mich immer. Es gibt ein bestimmtes Geräusch des Kieses, des Grases, der wehenden Blätter und des Raschelns der Bäume, und man hört Vögel im Gebüsch oder Eidechsen, die über den Weg laufen. Für mich sind das die Erinnerungen daran, dass du nicht allein bist, dass es einen Planeten und Leben um dich herum gibt und dass du ein Teil davon bist. ​ Das Gehen stellt die Verbindung zur Realität, zum Planeten Erde wieder her.

item.title: Время ходить - Время ходить с Джоном Чу
item.description: Джон М. Чу: Ходьба всегда успокаивает меня. Есть определенный звук гравия, травы, шелест листьев и деревьев, и вы можете услышать, как птицы разбегаются в кустах или пробегают ящерицы. И для меня это напоминание о том, что ты не один, что есть планета и жизнь вокруг тебя, и что ты - частичка этого мира. ​ Ходьба как бы восстанавливает связь с реальностью, с планетой Земля. ​ [ВСТУПИТЕЛЬНАЯ МУЗЫКА] ​ Сэм Санчес: Это “Время прогуляться”, где самые интересные и вдохновляющие люди в мире делятся историями, фотографиями и песнями, которые повлияли на их жизнь.

item.description: Wanda Sykes : Oh, j’adore aller marcher. Pas juste pour l’exercice, mais aussi l’occasion de discuter avec mes amis. Vous savez j’adore marcher avec ma femme. J’aime surtout la camaraderie, c’est ce que je préfère. Mi piace la compagnia, ecco cosa mi piace davvero. Quindi sono contenta di parlare con voi e immagino che anche a voi piaccia la compagnia, perché è per questo che mi state ascoltando parlare a ruota libera. ​ [INTRO MUSICA] ​ Sam Sanchez: Benvenuti a Time To Walk, dove alcune delle persone più interessanti e stimolanti del mondo condividono storie, foto e canzoni che hanno influenzato le loro vite.

item.title: Time to Walk - Time to Walk with Wanda Sykes
item.description: Wanda Sykes: Oh, I love going for walks. Not just good exercise for you, but I get a chance to catch up with my friends. You know, I love walking with my wife. I like the companionship, is what I really like. So I’m glad I have you guys here to talk to, and I guess you enjoy companionship, too, because that’s why you’re listening to me run my yap.

item.title: Zeit fürs gehen - Zeit fürs gehen mit Wanda Sykes
item.description: Wanda Sykes: Oh, ich gehe gerne spazieren. Das ist nicht nur eine gute Übung für dich, sondern auch eine Gelegenheit, mich mit meinen Freunden zu unterhalten. Ich gehe gerne mit meiner Frau spazieren. Ich mag die Gesellschaft, das ist es, was ich wirklich mag. Ich bin also froh, dass ich euch zum Reden hier habe, und ich schätze, ihr mögt auch die Gesellschaft, denn deshalb hört ihr mir zu, wenn ich mich ausheule.

item.title: Berkeley Haas - Dean's Speaker Series | Vanessa Morrison, BA, President of Streaming, Walt Disney Studios
item.description: Good afternoon everybody, I’m Ann Harrison. I’m the Dean at the Haas School of Business. Welcome everyone to the first Dean’s Speaker Series of our spring semester. I’m really excited and honored to introduce today’s speaker and Berkeley alum, Vanessa Morrison. Vanessa graduated with a bachelor’s in rhetoric from UC Berkeley class of ‘90. Today, Vanessa serves as president streaming for Walt Disney Studios Motion Picture Production. In this role, she has the responsibility

item.title: Lex Fridman Podcast - #316 - Noam Chomsky: Putin, Ukraine, China, and Nuclear War
item.description: Will there be a war between U.S. and China in the 21st century? If there is, we’re finished. A war between the U.S. and China would destroy the possibilities of organized life on Earth. The following is a conversation with Noam Chomsky, his second time on the podcast. This episode is focused on the war in Ukraine. And it is a departure from the way I usually do this podcast in several ways.

item.title: The Deck - Cindy Elias (6 of Diamonds, Minnesota)
item.description: Our card this week is Cindy Elias, the Six of Diamonds from Minnesota. Cindy was a 19-year-old college student enjoying a night out with friends when she made the decision to get into someone’s car, a decision that would change the course of her life and leave homicide detectives in Minnesota searching for answers for 45 years. To this day, her story remains the oldest unsolved case in the state, but efforts to

item.title: Huberman Lab - The Science of Emotions & Relationships
item.description: Welcome to the Huberman Lab Podcast, where we discuss science and science-based tools for everyday life. My name is Andrew Huberman, and I’m a professor of neurobiology and ophthalmology at Stanford School of Medicine. This podcast is separate from my teaching and research roles at Stanford. It is, however, part of my desire and effort to bring zero cost to consumer information about science and science-related tools to the general public.

item.title: Hora de andar - Hora de andar con Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell: Mi padre caminaba. Él regresaba a casa del trabajo todas las noches y pasaba una hora o más caminando, y también caminaba a la iglesia todos los domingos. Tan pronto como tuve la edad suficiente para caminar con él, lo hacía todos los domingos por la mañana, solo mi padre y yo. Creo que eran más o menos cinco kilómetros de ida y cinco de vuelta. Él nunca reducía la velocidad por mí.

item.title: Hora de caminhar - Hora de caminhar com Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell: Meu pai gostava de andar, ele chegava em casa do trabalho e saía para andar por uma hora ou uma hora e meia e ele também ia a pé até a igreja todos os domingos. Assim que eu tive idade para andar com ele, nós andávamos todas as manhãs, só nós dois. Andávamos cinco quilômetros para ir e cinco para voltar. Eu gostava do fato de ele achar que eu já era adulto o suficiente para acompanhá-lo.

item.title: Marcher - Marcher avec Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell : Mon père aimait marcher. Il rentrait le soir de son travail et partait se balader une heure ou plus. Tous les dimanches, il allait à pied jusqu’à l’Église. Quand je fus assez grand pour l’accompagner, je marchais avec lui tous les dimanches. Il y avait cinq kilomètres à l’aller et cinq kilomètres au retour. Il ne ralentissait jamais pour moi. Ça m’a toujours touché qu’il pense que je sois suffisamment adulte pour aller à son rythme.

item.title: Passeggiamo - Passeggiamo con Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell: Mio padre passeggiava molto, tornava a casa ogni sera dal lavoro e camminava per un’ora o più, camminava anche per andare in chiesa ogni domenica. E non appena sono diventato abbastanza grande da passeggiare con lui, camminavo ogni domenica mattina, solo io e mio padre. Credo che fossero poco meno di cinque chilometri e poi quasi altri cinque verso casa. Non rallentava mai per me. Ero sempre colpito dal fatto che mi considerasse abbastanza adulto da tenere il suo passo.

item.title: Time to Walk - Time to Walk with Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell: My father was a walker, and he would come home every night from work and go for an hour or more, and he would also walk to church every Sunday. And as soon as I was old enough to walk with him, I walked every Sunday morning, just me and my father. I think it was probably three miles and then three miles home. He would never slow down for me.

item.title: Zeit fürs gehen - Zeit fürs gehen mit Malcolm Gladwell
item.description: Malcolm Gladwell: Mein Vater war ein Wanderer. Er kam jeden Abend von der Arbeit nach Hause und ging eine Stunde oder länger, und er ging auch jeden Sonntag zur Kirche. Und sobald ich alt genug war, um mit ihm zu laufen, bin ich jeden Sonntagmorgen mit meinem Vater gelaufen. Ich glaube, es waren etwa drei Meilen und dann noch einmal drei Meilen nach Hause. Er wurde nie langsamer für mich. Es hat mich immer sehr berührt, dass er annahm, ich sei erwachsen genug, um mit ihm Schritt zu halten.

item.title: Время ходить - Время ходить с Малькольмом Гладуэллом
item.description: Малкольм Гладуэлл: Мой отец любил пешие прогулки, он каждый вечер возвращался домой с работы и отправлялся на прогулку, которая занимала час или больше, а также ходил в церковь каждое воскресенье. И как только я стал достаточно взрослым, чтобы ходить вместе с ним, мы стали гулять каждое утро в воскресенье. Только я и мой отец. Мне кажется, мы шли примерно пять километров туда и столько же назад домой. Он никогда не сбавлял скорость из-за меня.

item.title: Berkeley Haas - Dean's Speaker Series | Leigh Steinberg, Chairman and Founder of Steinberg Sports and Entertainment
item.description: Good evening, everyone. I’m Ann Harrison. I’m the dean at the Haas School of Business. Welcome to today’s Dean’s Speaker Series co-sponsored by the Haas Healthcare Association, John E. Martin Mental Healthcare Challenge. I’m honored to introduce and welcome back to campus a double bear in political science and law, Leigh Steinberg. (audience applauds) As chairman and founder of Steinberg Sports and Entertainment, Leigh is best known for his work building athletes

The camera on Magnus died 20 minutes into the conversation. Most folks still just listen to the audio through a podcast player anyway, but if you’re watching this on YouTube or Spotify, we did our best to still make it interesting
